跳过导航链接
  • 概览
  • 树
  • 索引
  • 搜索
  • 帮助

    所有类和接口

    类
    说明
    Activatable
    This interface provides a method to activates the object that implement this.
    Animatable
    The Animatable interface extends the Drawable interface to include methods for handling appearance and disappearance animations of an object.
    AnimatablePanel
    The AnimatablePanel class is an extension of JPanel that implements Animatable, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, MouseListener, Scalable, and Drawable.
    App
    The App class represents the main application window for the PianoTilesPro game.
    BoundedString
    The BoundedString class represents a drawable string with a specified bounding rectangle.
    Chart
    Represents a chart in the game, which contains the song's notes and gameplay elements.
    ChartButtons
    The ChartButtons class represents a collection of interactive buttons (Pause, Play, Restart, Back) used in a game interface.
    ChartText
    The ChartText class is responsible for displaying and updating the various statistics during gameplay on the chart screen.
    CollectionSelection
    Handles the collection selection menu functionality, including rendering, navigation, and user interactions.
    CollectionSelectionButtons
    Represents the buttons used in the collection selection menu for navigating left and right.
    CollectionSelectionText
    Represents the text components displayed in the collection selection menu.
    Control
    The Control class provides constants and utility methods for managing the application's state, user data, and resources.
    CRect
    Represents a rectangle shape with customizable position, size, and origin.
    CRectButton
    The CRectButton class represents a custom button with rectangular bounds and support for different states (normal, focused, and selected).
    CShape
    An abstract class representing a customizable shape with properties for fill color, outline color, and outline thickness.
    CTriangle
    Represents a triangle shape defined by three points.
    CTriangleButton
    The CTriangleButton class represents a button with a triangular shape and two states: normal and focused.
    Drawable
    This interface has a method that defines how to draw the object that implement this.
    DynamicCRectButton
    The DynamicCRectButton class represents a button with dynamic motion that can be scaled and focused.
    DynamicImage
    The DynamicImage class represents an image that can be animated by applying motions to its position over time.
    DynamicMotionManager
    The DynamicMotionManager class manages a collection of DynamicObjects and is responsible for activating and rendering them with respect to time.
    DynamicObject
    The DynamicObject class represents an object with dynamic motion properties.
    DynamicString
    The DynamicString class represents a dynamic string that can be moved over time according to specified motions.
    Focusable
    This interface lets an object detects mouse movement and define if the object is focused.
    HoldNote
    The HoldNote class represents a hold note in the rhythm game.
    JacketMenu
    This class is a menu that stores a list of Pair objects with a String name and a BufferedImage jacket.
    JudgementLimits
    The JudgementLimits class defines constants related to timing and scoring mechanics.
    KButton
    The KButton class serves as an abstract base class for buttons that implement the Drawable, Scalable, and Focusable interfaces.
    Lane
    Represents a lane in the game that holds notes, manages their visibility and judgement status, and processes updates for autoplay and user input.
    Main
    Main class of the program just calls the creating of a new App
    Motion
    A motion is an exponent function with respect to time.
    MotionManager
    Manages the motion of Note over time in the game.
    Note
    Represents a note in the rhythm game, containing properties for movement, timing, and judgment.
    Pair<A,B>
    A Pair is a set of two objects.
    ReferenceWindow
    The ReferenceWindow class defines constants for the reference window dimensions and positioning in the game.
    ResetUserButton
    The ResetUserButton class handles the button and associated logic for resetting user data.
    ResultPage
    Represents the result page of the game, which displays the outcome of a game session.
    ResultPageButtons
    The ResultPageButtons class represents the buttons (Back and Restart) on the result page of a game.
    ResultPageText
    Class responsible for managing and rendering the result page text and related graphics during the game.
    Scalable
    This interface defines how to scale an object that implements it when the window is resized.
    ScoreData
    Represents the score data for a game session, including the player's score, maximum combo, accuracy, worst hit time, and whether the player achieved a full combo (FC) or is playing a new chart.
    Selection
    The Selection class handles the selection of collections, songs, and associated data.
    SelectionButtons
    Represents a collection of interactive selection buttons, including back, settings, play, and user options.
    Settings
    The Settings class represents the settings menu for the application.
    SettingsCRectButtons
    The SettingsCRectButtons class handles the functionality and rendering of the setting buttons used to toggle user-specific settings such as sync, FC/AP (Full Combo/ All Perfect) hints, and hand hints.
    SettingsGeneralButton
    The SettingsGeneralButton class represents the general buttons used for settings navigation and actions, such as the back button, and the move left and move right buttons.
    SettingsSlidingButton
    The SettingsSlidingButton class represents the sliding buttons used in the settings menu to control values such as tolerance and music delay.
    SettingsText
    The SettingsText class handles the rendering and management of text and its boundaries in the settings menu.
    SlidingButton
    The SlidingButton class represents a UI component consisting of a base, a slider, and an optional verdict text.
    Song
    Represents a song in the game, including its metadata (composer, illustration, chart data) and provides access to song details such as the song's name, composer, chart information, and offset.
    SongSelection
    The SongSelection class handles the song selection interface, including navigation through the available songs, level selection, and the behavior of the UI elements related to the song selection panel.
    SongSelectionButtons
    The SongSelectionButtons class manages the creation and rendering of buttons for selecting songs and their difficulty levels in the song selection menu.
    SongSelectionText
    This class manages the dynamic elements and text rendering for the song selection menu.
    TapNote
    The TapNote class represents a tap note in the rhythm game.
    Triple<A,B,C>
    A Triple is a set of three objects.
    User
    Represents a user with their settings, game data, and score information.
    UserSelection
    Represents the user selection panel where users can select or create profiles and navigate options.
    UserSelectionButton
    Represents the set of buttons used in the user selection panel, including navigation, selection, and level options.
    UserSelectionText
    Represents the text information displayed in the user selection menu, including username, total data, cleared data, full combo data, and all perfect data.
    WelcomePage
    Represents the welcome page of the application, providing a graphical interface to load resources and navigate to the next panel.
